metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13054 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - high.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Cinnamon 1.9.2 through 3.8.6. The cinnamon-settings-users.py GUI runs as root and allows configuration of (for example) other users' icon files in _on_face_browse_menuitem_activated and _on_face_menuitem_activated. These icon files are written to the respective user's $HOME/.face location. If an unprivileged user prepares a symlink pointing to an arbitrary location, then this location will be overwritten with the icon content. Matthias Gerstner discovered that the cinnamon-settings-users utility in Cinnamon did not safely handle symlinks. An unprivileged user could potentially use this vulnerability to overwrite arbitrary files as root.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-13054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinnamon - 3.8.8-1
cinnamon-common - 3.8.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cinnamon package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.8-1').
